properties.headline: Bathurst 1000 - Thursday 15 to Sunday 18 October - BATHURST Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy, Mid-Western Hwy approaching Mount Panorama
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 4,000 people each day are expected to attend the annual Bathurst 1000 motor racing event from Thursday to Sunday at Mount Panorama. Gates open from 8.30am Thursday and 8am Friday to Sunday. Racing finishes between 5pm and 6pm each day.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on key roads between Sydney and Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Highway and Bells Line of Rd, and along the Mitchell Hwy from Orange, the Mid-Western Hwy from Cowra and the Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee.

Local roads in Bathurst are also expected to be busy. Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time in the area during the event.

arrangementElements.html:
BATHURST 

6AM MONDAY 12 OCTOBER UNTIL 2PM MONDAY 19 OCTOBER

  • Access to Mount Panorama Motor-racing Circuit will be limited to residents and accredited vehicles 
  • Ray Bant Drive will be under managed access
  • Access to the National Motor-Racing Museum (Ray Bant Drive) will be facilitated between Monday 12 October through to Wednesday 14 October (event week), the venue will be closed to the public on event days
  • Access to Mount Panorama Motor-Racing circuit via Hinton Road will closed

THURSDAY 15 OCTOBER UNTIL SUNDAY 18 OCTOBER

  • Access to Ray Bant Drive will be limited to Residents, Rydges guests/workers and accredited workers/vehicles
arrangementElements.title: Changed access arrangements

roads.mainStreet: Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy, Mid-Western Hwy
